00037 import copy, logging

00039 try:
00040     import networkx
00041 except ImportError:
00042     print '[WARNING]: The networkx module could not be imported in pyp_network.  Routines using networkx functionality are not available.'
00043

00050 ##
00051 # ped_to_graph() Takes a PyPedal pedigree object and returns a networkx DiGraph
00052 # object.
00053 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00054 # @param oid Flag indicating if original (1) or renumbered (0) IDs should be used.
00055 # @retval DiGraph object
00056 def ped_to_graph(pedobj, oid=0):
00057     """
00058     ped_to_graph() Takes a PyPedal pedigree object and returns a networkx DiGraph
00059     object.
00060     """
00061     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
00062     G = networkx.DiGraph(name=pedobj.kw['pedname'], selfloops=False, multiedges=True)
00063     for i in range(l):
00064         # The order in which we pass arguments to add_edge() is important -- the
00065         # parent has to be the first argument and the offspring the second if the
00066         # graph is to be ordered in the correct direction.
00067     #print 'Adding node %s' % ( i )
00068     if oid:
00069         G.add_node(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].originalID),
00070             sire=str(pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)].originalID),
00071             dam=str(pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)].originalID))
00072         #print G.node[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].originalID)]
00073     else:
00074             G.add_node(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID),
00075             sire=str(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID),
00076         dam=str(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID))
00077         #print G.node[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)]
00078         if str(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID) != str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00079             if oid:
00080                 G.add_edge(pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)].originalID, int(pedobj.pedigree[i].originalID), sex='s')
00081             else:
00082                 G.add_edge(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID), int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID), sex='s')
00083         if str(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID) != str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00084             if oid:
00085                 G.add_edge(pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)].originalID, int(pedobj.pedigree[i].originalID), sex='d')
00086             else:
00087                 G.add_edge(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID), int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID), sex='d')
00088 #        if str(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']) and str(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00089 #            if oid:
00090 #                G.add_node(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].originalID),
00091 #           sire=str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']),
00092 #           dam=str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']))
00093 #            else:
00094 #                G.add_node(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID),
00095 #           sire=str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']),
00096 #           dam=str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']))
00097     return G
00098 
00099 ##
00100 # find_ancestors() identifies the ancestors of an animal and returns them in a list.
00101 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00102 # @param anid The animal for whom ancestors are to be found.
00103 # @param _ancestors The list of ancestors already found.
00104 # @retval List of ancestors of anid.
00105 def find_ancestors(pedgraph,anid,_ancestors=[]):
00106     """
00107     find_ancestors() identifies the ancestors of an animal and returns them in a list.
00108     """
00109     anid = int(anid)
00110     #print 'anid:\t\t%d' % ( anid )
00111     try:
00112         _pred = pedgraph.predecessors(anid)
00113         for _p in _pred:
00114             if _p not in _ancestors:
00115                 _ancestors.append(int(_p))
00116             #print _ancestors
00117             find_ancestors(pedgraph,_p,_ancestors)
00118     except:
00119         pass
00120     return _ancestors
00121 
00122 ##
00123 # find_ancestors_g() identifies the ancestors of an animal going back a user-specified number of generations and returns them in a list.
00124 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00125 # @param anid The animal for whom ancestors are to be found.
00126 # @param _ancestors The list of ancestors already found.
00127 # @param gens Number of generations to go back in the pedigree.
00128 # @retval List of ancestors of anid.
00129 def find_ancestors_g(pedgraph, anid, _ancestors={}, gens=3):
00130     """
00131     find_ancestors_g() identifies the ancestors of an animal and returns them in a list.
00132     """
00133     #print 'anid:\t\t%d' % ( anid )
00134     #print 'gens:\t\t%d' % ( gens )
00135     if gens == 0:
00136         return _ancestors
00137     else:
00138         try:
00139             _pred = pedgraph.predecessors(anid)
00140             #print '_pred:\t\t%s' % ( _pred )
00141             for _p in _pred:
00142                 if _p not in _ancestors:
00143                     _ancestors[_p] = gens
00144                     find_ancestors_g(pedgraph, _p, _ancestors, gens-1)
00145         except:
00146             pass
00147     #print 'ancestors:\t%s' % ( _ancestors )
00148     return _ancestors
00149 
00150 ##
00151 # find_descendants() identifies the descendants of an animal and returns them in a list.
00152 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00153 # @param anid The animal for whom descendants are to be found.
00154 # @param _descendants The list of descendants already found.
00155 # @retval List of descendants of anid.
00156 def find_descendants(pedgraph, anid, _descendants=[]):
00157     """
00158     find_descendants() identifies the descendants of an animal and returns them in a list.
00159     """
00160     try:
00161         #print '\t%s\t%s' % ( anid, _descendants )
00162         _desc = pedgraph.successors(anid)
00163         for _d in _desc:
00164             if _d not in _descendants:
00165                 _descendants.append(_d)
00166                 find_descendants(pedgraph,_d,_descendants)
00167     except:
00168         pass
00169     return _descendants
00170 
00171 ##
00172 # immediate_family() returns parents and offspring of an animal.
00173 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00174 # @param anid The animal for whom immediate family are to be found.
00175 # @retval List of immediate family members of anid.
00176 def immediate_family(pedgraph, anid):
00177     """
00178     immediate_family() returns parents and offspring of an animal.
00179     """
00180     try:
00181         _family = networkx.neighbors(pedgraph,anid)
00182     except:
00183         pass
00184     return _family
00185 
00186 ##
00187 # count_offspring() returns the number of offspring of an animal.
00188 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00189 # @param anid The animal for whom offspring are to be counted.
00190 # @retval Count of offspring.
00191 def count_offspring(pedgraph, anid):
00192     """
00193     count_offspring() returns the number of offspring of an animal.
00194     """
00195     try:
00196       _count = len(networkx.neighbors(pedgraph,anid)) - len(pedgraph.predecessors(anid))
00197     except:
00198         _count = 0
00199     return _count
00200 
00201 ##
00202 # offspring_influence() returns the number of grand-children by each child of a given animal.
00203 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00204 # @param anid The animal for whom grand-progeny are to be counted.
00205 # @retval A dictionary of counts of progeny per child.
00206 def offspring_influence(pedgraph, anid):
00207     """
00208     offspring_influence() returns the number of grand-children by each child of a given
00209     animal.
00210     """
00211     try:
00212       _offspring = pedgraph.successors(anid)
00213       _degrees = networkx.degree(pedgraph, nbunch=_offspring, with_labels=True)
00214       # Correct for edges contributed by parents
00215       for _d in _degrees:
00216           _degrees[_d] = _degrees[_d] - len(pedgraph.predecessors(_d))
00217     except:
00218         pass
00219     return _degrees
00220 
00221 ##
00222 # most_influential_offspring() returns the most influential offspring of an animal as measured by their number of offspring.
00223 # @param pedgraph An instance of a networkx DiGraph.
00224 # @param anid The animal for whom the most influential offspring is to be found.
00225 # @param resolve Indicates how ties should be handled ('first'|'last'|'all').
00226 # @retval The most influential offspring of anid.
00227 def most_influential_offspring(pedgraph, anid, resolve='all'):
00228     """
00229     most_influential_offspring() returns the most influential offspring of an animal as
00230     measured by their number of offspring.
00231     """
00232     try:
00233         _max_off = -999
00234         _offid = -999
00235         _offdict = {}
00236         if resolve == 'all':
00237             _tempoffdict = {}
00238         _offspring = offspring_influence(pedgraph,anid)
00239         #print _offspring
00240         for _o in _offspring:
00241             # If there are ties, return the ID for the first offspring
00242             # seen with that number of progeny.
00243             if resolve == 'first':
00244                 if _offspring[_o] > _max_off:
00245                     _max_off = _offspring[_o]
00246                     _offid = _o
00247             # If there are ties, return the ID for the last offspring
00248             # seen with that number of progeny.
00249             elif resolve == 'last':
00250                 if _offspring[_o] >= _max_off:
00251                     _max_off = _offspring[_o]
00252                     _offid = _o
00253             # If there are ties, return the IDs for all offspring
00254             # with the highest number of progeny.
00255             else:
00256                 if  _offspring[_o] > _max_off:
00257                     _tempoffdict = {}
00258                     _tempoffdict[_o] = _offspring[_o]
00259                     _max_off = _offspring[_o]
00260                     _offid = _o
00261                 elif _offspring[_o] == _max_off:
00262                     _tempoffdict[_o] = _offspring[_o]
00263                     _offid = _o
00264         if resolve == 'all':
00265             _offdict = _tempoffdict
00266         else:
00267             _offdict[_offid] = _max_off
00268     except:
00269         pass
00270     return _offdict
00271 
00272 ##
00273 # get_founder_descendants() returns a dictionary containing a list of descendants of
00274 # each founder in the pedigree.
00275 # @param pedgraph An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00276 # @retval A dictionary containing a list of descendants for each founder in the graph.
00277 def get_founder_descendants(pedgraph):
00278     """
00279     get_founder_descendants() returns a dictionary containing a list of descendants of
00280     each founder in the pedigree.
00281     """
00282     try: logging.info('Entered get_founder_descendants()')
00283     except: pass
00284     founder_desc = {}
00285     for _n in pedgraph.nodes_iter():
00286         if pedgraph.in_degree(_n) < 2:
00287             _desc = {}
00288             _desc = find_descendants(pedgraph,_n,[])
00289             founder_desc[_n] = _desc
00290             print '\t%s\t%s' % ( _n, founder_desc[_n] )
00291     try: logging.info('Exited get_founder_descendants()')
00292     except: pass
00293     return founder_desc
00294 
00295 ##
00296 # get_node_degrees() returns a dictionary containing the number of
00297 # vertices (nodes) in pg with a given number of incoming, outgoing,
00298 # or total edges.
00299 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00300 # @retval A dictionary of dictionaries containing in, out, and total node degrees.
00301 def get_node_degrees(pg):
00302     """
00303     get_node_degrees() returns a dictionary containing the number of
00304     vertices (nodes) in pg with a given number of incoming, outgoing,
00305     or total edges.
00306     """
00307     try:
00308         node_degrees = {}
00309         node_degrees['in'] = {}
00310         node_degrees['out'] = {}
00311         node_degrees['all'] = {}
00312         for n in pg.nodes_iter():
00313             node_degrees['in'][n] = pg.in_degree(n)
00314             node_degrees['out'][n] = pg.out_degree(n)
00315             node_degrees['all'][n] = pg.degree(n)
00316         return node_degrees
00317     except:
00318         return 0
00319 
00320 ##
00321 # get_node_degree_histograms() returns a dictionary containing histograms of
00322 # the number of vertices (nodes) in pg with a given number of incoming,
00323 # outgoing, or total edges.
00324 # @param node_degrees A dictionary of dictionaries of in, out, and total node degrees.
00325 # @retval A dictionary of dictionaries containing in, out, and total degree histograms.
00326 def get_node_degree_histograms(node_degrees):
00327     """
00328     get_node_degree_histograms() returns a dictionary containing histograms of
00329     the number of vertices (nodes) in pg with a given number of incoming,
00330     outgoing, or total edges.
00331     """
00332     try:
00333         histogram = {}
00334         histogram['in'] = {}
00335         histogram['out'] = {}
00336         histogram['all'] = {}
00337         for i in range(0,max(node_degrees['in'].values())+1): histogram['in'][i] = 0
00338         for i in range(0,max(node_degrees['out'].values())+1): histogram['out'][i] = 0
00339         for i in range(0,max(node_degrees['all'].values())+1): histogram['all'][i] = 0
00340 
00341         for k in node_degrees['in'].keys():
00342             histogram['in'][node_degrees['in'][k]] = histogram['in'][node_degrees['in'][k]] + 1
00343 
00344         for k in node_degrees['out'].keys():
00345             histogram['out'][node_degrees['out'][k]] = histogram['out'][node_degrees['out'][k]] + 1
00346 
00347         for k in node_degrees['all'].keys():
00348             histogram['all'][node_degrees['all'][k]] =         histogram['all'][node_degrees['all'][k]] + 1
00349         return histogram
00350     except:
00351         return 0
00352 
00353 ##
00354 # mean_geodesic() calculates the mean geodesic (shortest) distance
00355 # between two vertices in a network.
00356 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00357 # @param debug Flag to turn debugging messages on (1) or off (0).
00358 # @retval The mean geodesic for the pedigree represented in pg.
00359 def mean_geodesic(pg, debug=0):
00360     """
00361     mean_geodesic() calculates the mean geodesic (shortest) distance
00362     between two vertices in a network.
00363     """
00364     length_sum = 0
00365     if networkx.is_directed_acyclic_graph(pg):
00366         n_pairs_with_paths = 0
00367     else:
00368         n_pairs_with_paths = ( pg.order() * ( pg.order() + 1 ) ) / 2
00369     tg = networkx.subgraph(pg, pg.nodes())
00370     for u in pg.nodes_iter():
00371         tg.delete_node(u)
00372         for v in tg.nodes_iter():
00373             try:
00374                 length = networkx.shortest_path_length(pg,u,v)
00375                 if length > 0:
00376                     length_sum = length_sum + length
00377                     if networkx.is_directed_acyclic_graph(pg):
00378                         n_pairs_with_paths = n_pairs_with_paths + 1
00379             except networkx.exception.NetworkXError:
00380                 pass
00381     try:
00382         geodesic = float(length_sum) / float(n_pairs_with_paths)
00383     except:
00384         geodesic = -999.
00385     if debug:
00386         print 'length_sum:\t', length_sum
00387         print 'n_pairs_with_paths:\t', n_pairs_with_paths
00388     return geodesic
00389 
00390 ##
00391 # graph_density() calculates the density of a digraph, which is the
00392 # ratio of edges in the gaph to the maximum possible number of edges.
00393 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00394 # @retval The density of the pedigree represented in pg.
00395 def graph_density(pg):
00396     """
00397     graph_density() calculates the density of a digraph, which is the
00398     ratio of edges in the gaph to the maximum possible number of edges.
00399     """
00400     pgn = pg.order()    # Number of nodes in pg
00401     pgne = pg.size()    # Number of edges in pg
00402     denom = pgn * ( pgn - 1 )
00403 
00404     try:
00405         density = float(pgne) / float(denom)
00406     except:
00407         return -999.
00408     return density
00409 
00410 ##
00411 # dyad_census() calculates the number of null, asymmetric, and
00412 # mutual edges between all pairs of nodes in a directed graph.
00413 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00414 # @param debug Flag to turn debugging messages on (1) or off (0).
00415 # @param debuglog Flag to turn debugging messages to the logfile  on (1) or off (0).
00416 # @retval A dictionary of counts.
00417 def dyad_census(pg, debug=0, debuglog=0):
00418     """
00419     dyad_census() calculates the number of null, asymmetric, and
00420     mutual edges between all pairs of nodes in a directed graph.
00421     """
00422     if not networkx.is_directed_acyclic_graph(pg):
00423         logging.error('pyp_network.dyad_census() requires a directed graph as input!')
00424         return 0
00425     else:
00426         census = {}
00427         census['null'] = 0
00428         census['asymmetric'] = 0
00429         census['mutual'] = 0
00430         tg = networkx.subgraph(pg, pg.nodes())
00431         for u in pg.nodes_iter():
00432             tg.delete_node(u)
00433             for v in tg.nodes_iter():
00434                 if not pg.has_neighbor(u,v):
00435                     census['null'] = census['null'] + 1
00436                 elif u in pg.predecessors(v) and v in pg.successors(u):
00437                     census['mutual'] = census['mutual'] + 1
00438                     if debug:
00439                         print 'Nodes %s and %s link to one another!' % ( u, v )
00440                     if debuglog:
00441                         logging.error('Nodes %s and %s link to one another!',u, v)
00442                 elif u in pg.predecessors(v) and v not in pg.successors(u):
00443                     census['asymmetric'] = census['asymmetric'] + 1
00444                 elif u not in pg.predecessors(v) and v in pg.successors(u):
00445                     census['asymmetric'] = census['asymmetric'] + 1
00446                 else:
00447                     pass
00448         del(tg)
00449         return census
00450 
00451 ##
00452 # mean_degree_centrality(pg) calculates mean in- and out-degree
00453 # centralities for directed graphs and simple degree-centralities
00454 # for undirected graphs. If the normalize flag is set, each node's
00455 # centralities are weighted by the number of edges in the (di)graph.
00456 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00457 # @param normalize Flag to turn normalization on (1) or off (0).
00458 # @retval A dictionary of mean degree centralities.
00459 def mean_degree_centrality(pg, normalize=0):
00460     """
00461     mean_degree_centrality(pg) calculates mean in- and out-degree
00462     centralities for directed graphs and simple degree-centralities
00463     for undirected graphs. If the normalize flag is set, each node's
00464     centralities are weighted by the number of edges in the (di)graph.
00465     """
00466     centrality = {}
00467     try:
00468         if networkx.is_directed_acyclic_graph(pg):
00469             cent_sum_in, cent_sum_out = 0, 0
00470             for n in pg.nodes():
00471                 n_cent_in = pg.in_degree(n)
00472                 n_cent_out = pg.out_degree(n)
00473                 if normalize:
00474                     n_cent_in = float(n_cent_in) / float(pg.size()-1)
00475                     n_cent_out = float(n_cent_out) / float(pg.size()-1)
00476                 cent_sum_in = cent_sum_in + n_cent_in
00477                 cent_sum_out = cent_sum_out + n_cent_out
00478             centrality['in'] = cent_sum_in / float(pg.order())
00479             centrality['out'] = cent_sum_out / float(pg.order())
00480         else:
00481             cent_sum = 0
00482             for n in pg.nodes():
00483                 if not normalize:
00484                     n_cent = pg.degree(n)
00485                 else:
00486                     n_cent = networkx.degree_centrality(pg,n)
00487                 cent_sum = cent_sum + n_cent
00488             centrality['all'] = cent_sum / float(pg.order())
00489     except:
00490         logging.error('pyp_network.mean_degree_centrality() failed!')
00491     return centrality
00492 
00493 ##
00494 # mean_value() calculates the mean from all values in a dictionary.
00495 # @param mydict A dictionary whose values are integers or reals.
00496 # @retval The mean of values in mydict.
00497 def mean_value(mydict):
00498     """
00499     mean_value() calculates the mean from all values in a
00500     dictionary.
00501     """
00502     try:
00503         mymean = float(sum(mydict.values())) / float(len(mydict.values()))
00504     except:
00505         logging.error('pyp_network.mean_values() failed!')
00506         mymean =  -999.
00507     return mymean
00508 
00509 ##
00510 # get_closeness_centrality(pg) returns a dictionary of the closeness
00511 # centrality (1/(average distance to all nodes from n)) for each
00512 # node in the graph.
00513 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00514 # @retval A dictionary of closeness centralities.
00515 def get_closeness_centrality(pg):
00516     """
00517     get_closeness_centrality(pg) returns a dictionary of the close-
00518     ness centrality (1/(average distance to all nodes from n)) for
00519     each node in the graph.
00520     """
00521     centrality = {}
00522     try:
00523         for n in pg.nodes():
00524             centrality[n] = networkx.closeness_centrality(pg,n)
00525     except:
00526         logging.error('pyp_network.get_closeness_centrality() failed!')
00527     return centrality
00528 
00529 ##
00530 # get_clustering_coefficient(pg) returns a dictionary of the clustering
00531 # coefficient of each node in the graph based on the definition of Watts
00532 # and Strogatz (1998).
00533 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00534 # @retval A dictionary of clustering coefficients.
00535 def get_clustering_coefficient(pg):
00536     """
00537     get_clustering_coefficient(pg) returns a dictionary of the clustering
00538     coefficient of each node in the graph based on the definition of Watts
00539     and Strogatz (1998).
00540     """
00541     clustering = {}
00542     try:
00543         for n in pg.nodes():
00544             clustering[n] = networkx.clustering(pg,n)
00545     except:
00546         logging.error('pyp_network.get_clustering() failed!')
00547     return clustering
00548 
00549 ##
00550 # get_betweenness_centrality(pg) returns a dictionary of the
00551 # betweenness centrality of each node in the graph.
00552 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00553 # @retval A dictionary of closeness centralities.
00554 def get_betweenness_centrality(pg):
00555     """
00556     get_betweenness_centrality(pg) returns a dictionary of the
00557     betweenness centrality of each node in the graph.
00558     """
00559     between = {}
00560     #try:
00561     between = networkx.betweenness_centrality(pg)
00562     #except:
00563         #logging.error('pyp_network.get_betweenness_centrality() failed!')
00564     return between
00565 
00566 ##
00567 # get_node_betweenness(pg) returns a dictionary of the
00568 # number of shortest paths that go through each node in
00569 # the graph.
00570 # @param pg An instance of a NetworkX DiGraph.
00571 # @retval A dictionary of node betweennesses.
00572 def get_node_betweenness(pg):
00573     """
00574     get_node_betweenness(pg) returns a dictionary of the
00575     number of shortest paths that go through each node in
00576     the graph.
00577     """
00578     between = {}
00579     #try:
00580     for n in pg.nodes():
00581         #between[n] = networkx.node_betweenness(pg,n)
00582         between[n] = networkx.betweenness_centrality(pg,n)
00583     #except:
00584         #logging.error('pyp_network.get_node_betweenness() failed!')
00585     return between
